thread.title: Warnings of delays ahead of this week's Australia Fiji clash
thread.title_full: Warnings of delays ahead of this week's Australia Fiji clash | Wales - ITV News

author: itv.com
title: Warnings of delays ahead of this week's Australia Fiji clash
text:
Rail customers are being warned of delays this Wednesday as thousands of rugby fans descend on the capital for Australia's clash with Fiji.
This was the scene on Sunday as thousands of fans left the Millennium Stadium Credit: Arriva Trains Wales Arriva Trains Wales say they will be providing extra services and more seating, but warn fans travelling in from Bridgend, Pencoed, Llanharan, Pontyclun and Cwmbran, Pontypool and Abergavenny will face delays.
Those travelling are being advised to catch the earliest trains possible, in order to arrive in plenty of time for the game.
It follows frustrations on Sunday after fans experienced 'severe overcrowding' and delays.
We will be adding extra services and capacity where possible throughout the day, however on some services, passengers may have to stand for part or all of their journey.
The usual post-match queuing system will be in place and we are expecting queues to be very busy especially for Bristol, Gloucester and London services.
Based on travel demand data and on Saturday evening's experience, we are predicting around 35,000 people wanting to travel back by train after the match. We can move on average 10,000 people per hour through our queuing system but unfortunately for some of the busier queues, this could mean up to a three hour wait.
However there is lots of capacity available and we will work hard to ensure that all our passengers are sent safely on their way by the end of the evening.
â€“ Lynne Milligan, Arriva Trains Wales Last updated Mon 21 Sep 2015 Read more 8 updates First Great Western apologises to rugby fans for train delays Travel Rugby world cup 2015 Cardiff
